meanings.sent1: The movie was overlong and made me feel bored.
meanings.sent2: The overlong book had too many unnecessary details.
meanings.sent3: The overlong line at the grocery store made me wish I had brought a snack.
meanings.sent4: Her overlong explanation about the weather felt like a never-ending storm.
meanings.sent5: The overlong scarf wrapped around her neck twice and still touched the ground.

meanings.definition: To a greater extent in length than is usual or necessary.
meanings.sent1: He tends to overlong his speeches, making them hard to follow.
meanings.sent2: I hope you don't overlong your visit, as I have other plans later.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to overlong the cooking time to ensure the dish was perfectly done.
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to overlong its banks after the heavy rainfall.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students not to overlong their answers during the exam.
